ie.gmit.sw

Class SubjectProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.sw.SubjectProcess

  • public class SubjectProcess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses ExecutorService where ThreadPool is created. Multiple threads runs the FileParser to read the file. And another ThreadPool submit SubjectShingleTaker. Where the results of that ThreadPool are assigned to Future interface to generate the ConcurrentHashMap. All the maps added to the BlockingQueue.
    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    Future

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SubjectProcess(java.util.List<java.lang.String> filesList, int k_mer_size, int maxFiles) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList()
      Names of all the files in the folder.
      java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer>> readSubjectFolder(java.lang.String folderName, int queueSize, int poolSize)
      This method runs the ExecuterService to create the Thread pool which submit the FileParser and SubjectShingleTaker classes which returns the ConcurrentHashMaps these maps are assigned to the Future interface where values can be retrieved by calling it's method get().

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubjectProcess

        public SubjectProcess(java.util.List<java.lang.String> filesList,
                      int k_mer_size,
                      int maxFiles)
        Parameters:
        filesList - File names in the folder.
        k_mer_size - Number of characters needs to be read from the file.
        maxFiles - Max number of files in the Subject folder.

    • Method Detail

      • readSubjectFolder

        public java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer>> readSubjectFolder(java.lang.String folderName,
                                                                                                                                        int queueSize,
                                                                                                                                        int poolSize)
                                                                                                                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                                                                                        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        This method runs the ExecuterService to create the Thread pool which submit the FileParser and SubjectShingleTaker classes which returns the ConcurrentHashMaps these maps are assigned to the Future interface where values can be retrieved by calling it's method get().
        Parameters:
        folderName - Name of the Subject folder which holds the multiple files in it.
        queueSize - Capacity of the BlockingQueue
        poolSize - Thread pool size
        Returns:
        BlockingQueue which holds all ConcurrentHashMaps
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Exception if interrupted
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - Exception during the execution process

      • getList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList()
        Names of all the files in the folder.
        Returns:
        List which holds the names of all the files in the folder.
